subject: In Production: Season 3
event:
For all those of you who do not [[YET]] have HBO, here's the promo video that aired earlier tonight, just before the BOARDWALK EMPIRE finale.

Enjoy.

<lj-embed id="338" />

comments.article: Nice to see some footage.  I see Mance, Edmure, Dondarrion, the Reeds, Jaime and Brienne fighting, and the Unsullied.  I like Dinklage's scar.
comments.subject: Cool!

comments.article: Hmm I on the other hand thought it was the only uncool part of the video... I mean, his head was slashed at full force with a sword, in the book he loses half a nose!! That looks like a scratch with a tree branch.
comments.subject: Re: Cool!

comments.article:
i am so ridiculously excited about this.

between this and getting the lands of ice and fire i'm having a great week.

First the release of a new TWOW chapter. Then on Sunday the season premiere.

So excited for the latter after seeing this promo, but we would all be more excited for the former if you gave us an early Christmas gift.

Maybe you can tell us which POV character we'll be reading from TWOW chapter that will come out 3/26 in the ADWD paperback edition.
comments.subject: March 26th and 31st.  The week of ASOIAF.

comments.article:
Meera!! So very happy to see the Reeds, such a relief!

I had doubts about Diana Rigg as Olenna Tyrell, but the costuming makes it perfection. i love being proved wrong sometimes!
comments.subject: Hooray!

comments.article:
The Reeds! Mance! Those costumes, everything looks amazing!!

....but, no Sansa that I could see... :(

Well, we know there will be plenty of Sansa. The books tell it so. :) I can't watch too many teasers sometimes, or I wax nostalgic for the HBO Game of Thrones series and that's not productive. I patiently await with a quiet excitement for March 31st. Time for me to start reading a Dance with Dragons now too....OR...I might reread ASOS & AFOC, THEN ADWD. So many options to enter an escape into Westeros.
:)

comments.upictitle: The world is a laboratory to the enquiring mind: a_ezio_smile
comments.article:
Ohhhhh, what a tease!
Can't wait to see Arya and Tyrion again...and oh hai, Jojen Reed.
Thomas Sangster was a good choice!
Oh, BEFORE the finale! I was looking afterwards. Thanks for posting!

Thanks for sharing this video with us.
The expectations will once more rise even higher... oh my.
Thumbs up, nevertheless.
Thank you for posting this Mr Martin. :)
Can't wait.

I came only to say that just finished A Dance with Dragons (Danza de dragones en mi idioma :D) and you are becoming my favorite writer. Keep the good work.

By the way, great new season promo. Expecting it :D
comments.subject: Awesome

comments.article: Good news!
The Reeds!  Everything looks amazing.  The production values seem to get better and better.
Looks amazing!

comments.upictitle: ☁ come the dawn, we shall see: ♚ (team stannis) . to the bitter end
comments.article:
Lovely costumes. So great to catch a glimpse of EDMURE & MANCE yay ♥
But no Stannis :(((
Thanks for posting this - we have HBO, but HBO Canada didn't show this promo last night, sigh.
Holy crap I can't wait for this.  Thoros, Dondarrion and Mance oh my.  Margaery Tyrell is crazy hot.
comments.subject: Seven Hells!

comments.article:
Looking great. Lucky for me summer is only beggining and I'm mostly waiting for TWOW, but I'll forget about book and series while wishing this summmer lasts forever. I love when this happens, La Pedrera is so awesome. So are westeros stories.
The crannogfolk appear at last, and the great King beyond the wall. This WILL get interesting.
Hope The Queen of thorns gets as scheming and dramatic as the book.
I have watched this four times already, simply delightful.
Just 4????? haha you mispelled 24!

So, the real question for this season: Will HBO finally see the light and provide a way for GoT's fans to watch the season and support the series without paying Comcast's extortion fees.

To be clear, I have no problem paying HBO whatever they want for GoT. Through Comcast, I pay them an additional $10/month (not all of which gets to them, I'm sure). If I had to, I would pay $60/month direct to HBO.
However, I will NOT pay Comcast $50+$10/month for (lousy) service that I don't want or need, just to get access to HBO's content. I'm sure many other Comcast-hating fans will make a similar choice.

Comcast is cable, yes?

If you don't want cable, go satellite.

I'm with DirecTV myself, and love the service. Not only do I get HBO, I get NFL Season Ticket.
can't w8 4 it
comments.subject: games of thrones

comments.upictitle: La Fille dans le Miroir: blossoms
comments.article:
I first saw this posted while I was browsing the internet in my living room (laptop). Other family members were watching the tv, and I had earphones in. I screamed out OH MY GOSH I THINK I SEE BERIC DONDARRION AND THE BROTHERHOOD WITHOUT BANNERS AND OH MY GOSH I THINK I'M GOING TO DIE OF ANTICIPATION.

I *JUST* finished reading A Storm of Swords (absolutely amazing, one of the best books I've read - and I read a LOT), and now I'm into A Feast for Crows.

The last time I was this excited about a book series was when Harry Potter was coming out and I was but a teen.

I cannot express in words my love for A Song of Ice and Fire.

I just subscribed to HBO to get ready for Season 3! I love your books and this show has been incredibly engaging. The casting was very well done. Rarely do I feel that a show or movie really captures characters as they appear in text, but that is definitely happening here. Please keep up the great work!
comments.subject: HBO Subscribed

comments.article: and ofcourse I now to come to one of life's greatest dilemma's...am i finally old enough to watch the series? considering i have my highschool finals coming up....i don't think so...maybe next year *sigh* in the mean time i'll just reread the series :D
comments.subject: Can't wait...
